Key Match Events: The Royals lost Game 4 of the American League Division Series to the Yankees at Kauffman Stadium, 3-1.
The Royals had flyouts at the very edge of the warning track in right field, near-homers knocked down into Juan Soto's glove.
The Royals' offense disappeared the final month of the regular season and for most of the postseason.
The Royals' bullpen held the Yankees scoreless the final three innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Bobby Witt Jr. said the loss 'just kind of feels like you let a lot of people down' and'something that will light a torch in you.'
Michael Massey said the season 'creates a different buzz around the clubhouse.'
Matt Quatraro said the Royals 'battled their butts off, man' and 'gave everything they had.'
Vinnie Pasquantino said the loss'stings. A lot.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals' 2024 season was built on its pitching, particularly its rotation, but not one of their starters pitched into the sixth inning this series.
The Royals won 86 games for a 30-win turnaround and became the third team in Major League history to make the postseason following a 100-loss season.
The Royals' rotation was fueled by one of the best rotations in baseball.
Others: The Royals had a team chemistry that was evident all year and added to the hope of making a deep October run.
The Royals' starters were on a shorter leash in the postseason due to the urgency of the situation.
The Royals' closer, Lucas Erceg, was brought in to keep the game close instead of letting him sit in the bullpen in hopes of being in the perfect situation in the ninth inning.
